Reviews.Title: “clean + modern, central location”
Reviews.Author: LisaJ_HH
Reviews.Content: Located in a quiet side street off Champs-Elysées, the Beauchamps is ideal for either business or leisure trip. Most of the main sights and the river Seine are within walking distance, 2 Metro stations close by. The hotel room was - for Paris standards - a good size (on other occasions, I have stayed in a 1 bed room which is small but enough, e.g. on a business trip). The rooms seem rather new and modern, and I was always happy with their cleanliness. Very friendly staff as well, they helped me with reservations for exhibitions etc. I did not try the restaurant - for breakfast, there is a bakery just across the street, and a "Paul" café around the corner, with fantastic croissants etc. I can definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and room to move!”
Reviews.Author: Jean A
Reviews.Content: Being a fan of shabby chic has led us tio stay in characterful, but somewhat cramped and lift free rooms in France's capital! This hotel only minutes from Franklin D Roosevelt metro on the Champs Elysee was much more spacious (we had an upgrade to a superior room) with decent plumbing. The staff were very charming with an excellent command of English if that's what you want and the buffet breakfast superb.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Weekend in Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: Merc9SLK
Reviews.Content: Literally arrived home early hours this morning following 2 nights in a superior room B&B in this perfectly located hotel. We obtained this hotel through Voyage Prive and the price we paid was amazing compared to hotel tarrif. We booked own flights through Flybe and caught Roissy Bus from CDGaulle airport to Opera for 10 Euros p/person. We stupidly did not plan our route to reach hotel in advance, however free maps in airport - Rue de Pointiue is parallel with Champs Elyssee - near central point. We walked from Opera to hotel, took about 1/2 hour 1st time - down Rue Massenbeuh (something to that effect!) onto Rue de Boîte, turn left off here. Hotel staff are so friendly and multi lingual, shame because often fun trying to speak the lingo. Understated fascade to hotel, modern and clean inside. Made to feel very welcome. Our room 156 on 1st floor facing a bar and a small Chinese cafe. Good size, given trip advisor reviews stated small. Comfy bed, mini bar with plenty room for own items. Microwave also! Bath robes and slippers always nice. Disturbed both nights sleep from partying revellers on the street, shouting men - huge temptation to lean out of window and shout back "fermez la Bouche!". Could hear underground - only a little, only realised what it was due to other trip advisor reviews. Didn't bother us. Breakfast excellent, not a huge choice but adequate. All fresh produce, croissants, cheese, ham, pancakes, yogurt, different breads and your usual trad. English fry up. Non greasy, scrambled eggs gorgeous! Loved the courgette and the hash browns non greasy too. Staff were delightful, shame all hotels you stay at don't have staff like these! Excellent location for sight seeing, we did everything on foot (yes my legs are now killing me!) Paris is expensive - dearer than London but cheaper than Barbados! Tiny glass of wine will set you back 6-8 Euros, same for a beer! Amazing when both are French so not imported..........!!! Be prepared to queue ......and i mean queue at all tourist sights, sorry we did not - the prices astronomical! 14 Euros each to get into the Louvre with 3 fascades of the pyramid queuing!!! Ok if you dont want to see Lonardo de Vinci painting you pay only 10 Euros p/person. Eiffel Tower, thought I was at a football match amount of people queuing - personally preferred it from a distance. The boat ride on Seine, we would have if we hadn't seen half the sites on day 1 on foot. 15 Euros boat ride p/person hop on/off at each sight. Enormous queue for ticket, then another queue double size each time boat arrived! Moulin Rouge situated in Montmartre area, very seedy, not a place to take your kids. Drunks and homeless people in this area, streets littered and not so clean witnessed a few arrests from thieves operating in gangs in this area - handbags. Also, champs Elyssee, evenings teenage females of BME appearance will walk at speed into you and them check what they managed to steel at the shop entrances. Saw this happen so be careful. Finally, try the Paul Boulanger near hotel - turn left outside hotel entrance, keep walking and on you right, fabulous cougette quiche, strawberry tarts and other delectable items!!! Also, Chez Diep Chinese/Vietnamese next to hotel - pricy altho great food and female host superb! We would not return to Paris, seen it, although would highly recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, definitely will be coming back”
Reviews.Author: Deborah77s
Reviews.Content: It is just 2 minutes from Champ de Elysees and metro station. The room was big, the bed was comfy, the bathroom was so modern and there was microwave. The staff was so helpful and speak good English. It is a very nice hotel with reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: FishChipsandSalsa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took an early Spring 2 night getaway there last March. We have 3 beautiful children (that my mum & dad took care of while we were away) so this was our first getaway since our 3rd was born. It was nice to get away, go somewhere small yet near all the big sights. This hotel was centrally located near the Champs- Elyssee's, has small cafe's and restaurants near by. The only negative is that it is near some loud night clubs but that does not bother us. We did not go to Paris to sleep. We ate our way through Paris, took in all the sights and passed out on the comfortable bed - we were shattered. What night clubs? The room was comfortable, modern and small...but that is what you get in a small boutique hotel in central Paris. We loved the artful and color concept of the hotel as it add's to your romantic mood. Over all, this is a great place for a couple if you are going on a slight budget and want to take in all the wonderful aspects of Paris. The breakfast looked great but we opted for venturing out into the random cafe's of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent,Excellent,Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Martin S
Reviews.Content: Great Price, Great Location and with some much nightlife restaurants and cafes, My Wife and I had a ball, the first day we spent 10 hours walking, no metro, was up for Sunrise at 7:53am on the Alexander the 3nd Bridge about 15 minutes from hotel breakfast Concorde Plaza the rue d'la opera then Notre Dame and the Cafes all within walking distance. Fantastic place with a Patissere on the corner loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location nearby lots of restaurants”
Reviews.Author: Jack C
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful boutique hotel off the Champs Elysees. (about EUR 55 and 45mins from CDG airport) The front desk and house keeping staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are decent sized and very cozy. But the best part about the hotel is its location! It's 2 min walk from the Roosevelt station (the line that goes to the Arch de Triomphe, Louvre and Notre Dame) and extremely close to A LOT of bistros and restaurants. It's also within 5min walking distance to Monoprix (supermarket) for those of you who want to keep cheap bottle water in your room like me. They have free WiFi, which is great, not that you'll stay in the room for long when you're in Paris. The breakfast is decent but never changed during the week I stayed there. It does have hot dishes like bacon, scrambled eggs, and mushroom for those of you who like something hot in the morning like me. The wait staff over the weekend is cold and while professional, not very pleasant. The weekday wait staff is much more friendly. I highly recommend this hotel especially for its location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for tourism”
Reviews.Author: inst
Reviews.Content: Considering Paris hotel pricey scene, this hotel has fairly good features . Beautiful lobby and great staff, excellent breakfast and good location, well connected to other areas. We had a deluxe room that was the biggest I have ever stayed in/seen in Paris, double glazing stopped the noise from the busy street-not a beautiful one. On a general note Paris rooms are always very very small...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastically located Parisian hotel.”
Reviews.Author: emilyhopcroft
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a long weekend in Paris staying at this gorgeous hotel. It is in a perfect location for sightseeing just off for the Champs Elysee and only a 10-15 minute walk to Louvre. The hotel was exactly what we needed for a weekend away. We were staying in a Deluxe Suite which was very spacious and nicely decorated and cleaned daily. At breakfast, there is a wide ranging and tasty selection of both hot breakfast (scrambled eggs, bacon, beans etc) and cold (cereals, yoghurt, ham, cheese) so there is something for everyone. The dining room is also very well decorated and a pleasure to sit in. Another special mention must go to the staff who were always on hand to organise and reccommend everything from trips to restaurants and routes. My only negative point is that both myself and my partner were awoken on the Friday and Saturday night by the club opposite which was incredibly noisy. I am sure this is just the case some weekends but apart from that; a fantastic stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Finally, tea and coffee making facilities”
Reviews.Author: Jenanic
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a standard room for 2 nights. The location is convenient to Metro stations, the champs elysees and several clubs. The rooms are clean, reasonably sized with modern decor and good sized bathrooms. There is a supermarket conveniently 50m down the street for tea/coffee, sugar, wine, beer etc. Reconsider having your laundry done here. It may not be worth the 200 euros we paid. It did look good though.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel with incredible staff.”
Reviews.Author: Robert C
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend in Paris and stayed at this fantastically locationed hotel. Our rooms were a little small but perfectly presented. What made our stay so enjoyable was the fantastic service of Manueline Carillo, nothing was a bother to him, even escorting us to his recommended brasserie/cafe - the best concierge I have had the pleasure of meeting in 40 years of travel. One slight complaint was the opening hours of the bar and restaurant......closed on a Saturday???

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: nadomom
Reviews.Content: My family of five recently stayed at the Hotel Beauchamps for a week. We had one "superior room" and a "family suite", both of which were comfortable, well decorated, clean and quiet. I was dissatisfied with our original rooms and the front desk immediately moved us. The hotel itself is ideally located a block off of the Champs Elysee, surrounded by restaurants, and with a Metro stop a block away. The staff of the hotel are professional and eager to help. All in all, we were very satisfied with our stay and would recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: ediroque
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, perfect location for main tourist sites. The elevator (in the wing we stayed) is really small- 3 persons w/o luggage. But what impressed us was the staff. Always smiling, and left no request unattended! They all speak very good English, including the housekeeper!

Reviews.Title: “Very lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lozza_2012
Reviews.Content: Have just returned for a 3day trip to Paris. We wasn't originally meant to be staying in this hotel, but because of over booking in our original hotel, we were put here for one night. On arrival, the hotel was contemporary, clean, fresh looking. Staff at Check In were helpful and our room was ready straight away. Room was lovely and en suite was clean. Shower leaked slightly but we informed the reception when we left.(room 608) Location of this hotel was perfect. 2 minute walk to the Champs Elysees Ave, where you can see the Arc De Triomphe. Breakfast was a bit of a shambles, the restaurant area wasn't big enough and the cooked food was cold!!! Overall, the location and staff at this hotel were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: poysoniv
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my week long stay here. The location is excellent- right by champs elysees (i think its like a 2 min. walk and you are where all the action is). The hotel is a modern and the staff is very easy going and helpful. They helped us with making reservation to places we wanted to go to right away. I had a spacious room on the 5th floor in the remodeled part of the hotel. There are a couple cool restaurants and bars right next to the hotel. Also, across the street, there's a very good boulangerie. The staff is not very polite to tourists, but the food is yummy. They also have coffee there, so it's a great breakfast spot. There's also a paul bakery and a laduree (on champs elysees) very close by, but it's not open at the moment. I'd definitely stay here again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Mum and Daughter weekend”
Reviews.Author: tonywalker
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time - made even better by the incredibly helpful staff. Manuel Carrillo in particular was amazing on several occasions during our stay. Great style, location, rooms and people

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: cmartigani
Reviews.Content: Fantastic stay. There was a minor misunderstanding w/our Expedia reservation and we were upgraded from a triple to a mini suite (470). We stayed for a week with our 84 y/o mom and we had a very nice stay.The staff is courteous, very knowledgeable and extremely helpful. Room was adequately sized and had separate shower, bathtub and toilet. There was a small fridge and a microwave, which came in handy as we sometimes bought some delicious food in the patisserie across the street and dined in the room w/a bottle of wine. This is ideal for when you have walked all day and are too tired to go out for dinner. Regardless, Paris was surprisingly less expensive this time than at previous trips. The location is superb, a block away from Champs Elysees and a major Metro station (F. D. Roosevelt). There are many lovely bistros, and stores to shop at, as well as Monoprix and Franprix where they sell groceries, fresh and frozen foods within a 2 block radius. The hotel has a wonderful buffet breakfast at $20 Euros per person, which although pricey was of excellent quality and allowed us to bypass lunch for a snack and dinner, when we were out all day. Well worth it. One minor issue is the hotel's computer which is slow, freezes up and has a barely working keyboard in case one wants to check e-mail. We did not bring our own as we wanted to really rest from anything resembling work. I brought this up to them and they indicated they'd pass it on to management. We'll see.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Holger P
Reviews.Content: We have been in this Hotel 21.10.2011-24.10.2011 in room 470. Everything was excellent - from the beginning at the reception until the departure. The room was large and clean, and we liked that there was a separeted bath, shower and toilet. Most remarkable was the Concierge (Manuel?), who always did everything to help us and to make our stay wonderful. We were travelling with a little girl, 2 years old, which is not always easy. Manuel always gave us support, getting the buggy ready and trying to find good restaurants, where little children are welcome as well. He did not only tell us - he took us on our hands and guided us to a good restaurant and made it possible, to get a table. Thanks a lot for Everything!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: abscee
Reviews.Content: Hotel Beauchamps was better than I had expected. Decor is contemporary, excellent service and the 5th floor room was spacious and clean. The bed and quality bedding gave me the best nights sleep in a long time. Free wifi, and located minutes from the Champs Elysees, Beauchamps will be my first choice when planning my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, service and breakfast (but with a typical Parisian problem)”
Reviews.Author: anonymous01
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located to explore the highlights of the city. And there are plenty of taxi stands and metro stops around. Positive: staff is professional and helpful, breakfast is nice. Free internet and comfortable bed. Negative: The room we stayed in was very small, but that is normal in Paris. You could barely walk around the bed. Bed just next to bathroom with a sliding door, as there was no space for a proper door. Biggest problem however is the noise from the metro. We stayed on the third floor at the courtyard, but we could not sleep. You hear and feel the rumble of the metro passing by every other minute from 5.30 am till 01.00 am. The manager was extremely nice and understanding when we complained about it. And just like the noise problem on the front of the hotel (they have installed extra double windows), I am sure they will try to fix this problem too. So again nice hotel which we can recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, bad neighbours”
Reviews.Author: João P
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very close to Champs Elysee, it is nice and cosy. Rooms are quite small, but bed is comfortable. In front of the hotel is a club, so expect noise all night long, however if you are into clubbing you just have to cross the street. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice but Tiny rooms!”
Reviews.Author: travellinggirl14
Reviews.Content: The hotel offers a very warm welcome on arrival and front desk staff could not have been more helpful. The room I shared with my daughter (twin room) was tiny with a very low ceiling...............not for the claustrophobic! However the streets behind the Champs Elysee where the hotel is situated have many bijoux restaurants and it's convenient foer when heading into Paris on foot.

Reviews.Title: “great location. fabulous hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LJWncl
Reviews.Content: couldn't fault this hotel. staff bent over backwards from booking requests (adjacent rooms for family) to giving advice about tourist attractions. location 2 mins from Champs-Elysées. rooms a good size: clean and tidy.

Reviews.Title: “"Better than our highest expectations!"”
Reviews.Author: tgehring
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about our 5 night suite stay with our two older daughters. There was plenty of space (which is rare in a Paris hotel) for four adults to not feel the least bit crowded. Our room overlooked the small interior space--not a real courtyard, but who cares when you can so easily stroll the Champs Elysee! Also, we were absolutely spoiled by the exceptional care and attention the front-desk personnel provided; especially Manuel Carrillo. Whenever we followed his suggestions for improving our sight-seeing, we were never disappointed. I was skeptical when he suggested we take a bus to Montmartre instead of the subway (to enjoy the sights more), but he was absolutely correct about how doing this would make our adventure much more enjoyable. He always took the time to make certain that we understood his mapped-out instructions and always followed up upon our return to see if our day was as perfect as promised. The Hotel Beauchamps is lucky to have him and his attention to detail. We highly recommend staying at this charming and impeccably clean, caring establishment!

Reviews.Title: “Excellente!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jlogue
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned after celebrating our first anniversary in Paris and we loved it! The hotel beauchamps is a beautiful wee hotel in a great central location. 2mins walk from the Champs Elysee, 5 mins Arc de Triomphe, 30 mins walk from The Louvre and 20 mins walk from The Eiffel Tower, (we did a lot of walking!!) The staff at the Beauchamps are very friendly and attentive to your needs. The hotel is clean and modern with some beautiful artwork from local artists dotted around. The only negative thing I have to say about this hotel is the breakfast! 20 euros per person and it was rubbish, poor choice poor quality no atmosphere don't do it

Reviews.Title: “Only the location!”
Reviews.Author: libra1977uae
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel for one week, unfortunately can't change the plan! The reception quite attractive, renovated; what it counts for is the location ONLY that is close to the champs, on the other hand, it was noisy due to that it's close to the bars and the street car horns!! The room was too small, not suitable for a family with kids, the bathroom very standard, with a standing shower!! From my experience hotels either have showers and bath tubs or just bath tubs!!! Though it turned from 3 to a 4 star hotel!!!! the rate was'nt worth it AT ALL!!! I could have paid it in a better 4 star hotel!! Bad choice this time!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, service especially Manuel and Alexandra”
Reviews.Author: Nena68_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded all my expectations. Location is central to everything. The rooms were comfortable and deserving of a 4 star european rating. Alexandra Moumer and Manuel Carillo went above and beyond in the customer/guest service. Always pleasant, helpful and proactive. Alexandra assisted us with navigating with Air France on our lost baggage and once I let Manuel know that our next stop was Madrid, he immediately printed out some information on Madrid. I will definitely recommend this place to all my friends and this will always be my choice of hotel whenvever I visit Paris!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, very well located, room size is excellent , actually I enjoyed my stay in this hotel and the team was very helpful.”
Reviews.Author: FMarzouk
Reviews.Content: The hotel represents the real spirit of paris and the beautiful nature of its people.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: mylahrules
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights early May 2011. Great location 1 block off Champs-Elysees. The hotels restaurant was great. But also many neighborhood cafe's and shops near by for food & bev. Staff was very friendly and helpful with directions and suggestions for restaurants. Rooms are modern and very clean, great bathrooms! Would recommend to any friend to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel,perfectly situated.”
Reviews.Author: theexporters
Reviews.Content: Hotel Beauchamps is ideally situated just off the Champs-Elysees. The hotel is spotlessly clean and the staff are very helpful. The rooms are VERY small. We booked a Superior Room which was not only small but also backed on to the lift which was annoyingly noisy. On mentioning this fact we were advised that all the superior rooms on each floor backed on to the lift.and therefore all had the same issue. We were however offered a higher standard room which was lovely.Apparently the Hotel has had a facelift ( modern) and whilst it looks lovely we felt some things were missing for the sake of appearance. i.e bedside table.no shelf etc for toiletries in the bathroom and no full length mirror

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Champs Élysées”
Reviews.Author: Travelat50
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel at the recommendation of a law firm whose offices are close by. I found the staff of the hotel to be very helpful and was able to have an early check-in which is always appreciated when travelling overseas. The room/accomodations were fine. It's just that I was on the ground floor and could feel the subway pass under my room, a bit. Otherwise, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Excellent staff and service, Convienient location to Metro and Restaurants”
Reviews.Author: traveller2793
Reviews.Content: A nice change to the big convention hotels we normally stay at while in Paris. Very convienient location to a wide variety of dining establishments. Rooms are on the smaller side, but they have been recently remodeled and are in very nice condition. I understand they will be replacing the street facing windows with dual panes to cut down on noise that the other reviews have mentioned. The staff could not have been any more helpful. Special thanks to Stephanie and Manuel, who were very helpful in planning countryside excursions on the weekend. I wil be erturnning to this hotel on subsequent trips.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great, central location”
Reviews.Author: Dijkstra86
Reviews.Content: Beauchamps is a nice hotel, located close to the Champs Elysees and has very good value-for-money. The staff is very friendly and helpful, the rooms are clean, and breakfast is good. My room was quite small, but this shouldn't be a problem since it would be a pity to spend much time in your room with so many things to see and do nearby. The only improvement I can think of is a decent quality iron device with steam option, the basic iron they provide is not very useful when trying to get the wrinkles out of your shirt. Other than this minor issue I can recommend this hotel to everybody!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel next to Champs Elysees”
Reviews.Author: Maur75
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for New Years Eve week, and the hotel beat my expectations. The hotel is located one street off of Champs Elysees. I loved the location because, while super close to Champs Elysees, it was on a quieter not hectic street. I travel quite frequently, and have been to Paris several times. This was one of my best hotel experiences in Paris I ever had. The hotel lobby was chic and looked new. The rooms were nice, too. My only warning... the hallways and rooms all had low ceilings. I'm 6'2, and I felt that if I was 1 or 2 inches taller, I would be hitting the ceiling. My room was quite small, too, but this is normal for Paris hotel. The room was well-appointed and very clean and modern. The staff was very nice. It was my first time in Paris where the people were all happy to let me practice my French! Usually when I speak my not-perfect French, Parisians immediately speak to me in English. Every staff member, including the waitress at the hotel's restaurant, continued to speak to me in French or helped me when I forgot a word in French. In short, everyone was friendly and courteous. Some nice touches... wi-fi internet was free (I hate other hotels that will charge you $300/night, and then nickel-and-dime you), and breakfast was free (at least, I didn't think I had paid for an increased rate that had included breakfast). And amazingly, there was no extra charge to have breakfast sent to your room. It was such a pleasure to have breakfast in bed on New Year's Day!! I am a veteran traveler. As long as you're not too tall, and your room size expectations are proper for Paris, then this hotel was great! Lastly, as for price, it wasn't cheap, but for New Year's week and location next to Champs Elysees, it was not as expensive as many others in the area.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: saps_76
Reviews.Content: i was at Paris for a conference at Palais de congres and this hotel is very close from there, just 4 metro station. Beauchamps is very beautiful hotel and has great ambiance. the service is very good and fast. staff is courteous, knowledgeable and quick. rooms are comfortable and amenities are good. food is good. also there are many good hotels, clubs and stores nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Love at first sight in Paris, with a few hidden flaws”
Reviews.Author: astro17
Reviews.Content: This is a long review, but we personally went crazy trying to find pictures and detailed information about this newly remodeled hotel; we're hoping we save someone else some trouble. My husband and I moved across town to the Beauchamps after staying in an ok, but definitely small, "business" class hotel for a conference near the Place de République. Our 6 nights in the Beauchamps were meant to be a very special treat to celebrate our first trip to Europe together and our first real vacation in almost 2 years. We had spent an incredible amount of time beforehand trying to choose a nice, elegant, modern hotel near the Champs-Élysées and flip-flopped between several hotels and then, several room sizes, before fixing on this room. The moment we walked into the room, we knew we had made the correct choice. It was love at first sight. We paid extra to be in the "Superior" room and I think it was worth every penny. First off, the room was fairly large by any standard and huge by Parisian standards. It had a very comfortable, queen-sized bed, a medium-sized desk, a refrigerator, a microwave, a small closet (enough for hanging maybe 3 days worth of clothes for two people), a palatial bathroom with a shower that could easily fit about 4 people, and (very important for Paris in July) fairly good air-conditioning. The decor was very modern and everything was spotlessly clean with nice little amenities like a bathrobe, slippers, an umbrella, a tea kettle, a corkscrew, and a "bar" sink. Overall, the room and lobby spaces were everything we could image. We did have some complaints, mostly about service. The hotel offers a large number of amenities - which no one at the front desk seems to know about. It took until our fourth try to manage to get the pillows we wanted from the oft bragged-about "pillow menu"! They also had no idea that they offered a shoe-shine service (which my husband desperately needed after three weeks of walking the European streets). Normally we wouldn't care at all about any of these things, but the bizarre thing is that the "hotel" went out of the way to offer all these neat extras while the hotel staff looked at us like we were a little crazy when we requested them. The housekeeping was quite disappointing for this level of hotel. One day they took our towels and didn't replace them, leaving us only a face towel. Most days we didn't have a floor mat. The robe disappeared after one day and never reappeared. The tea cups and glasses were not washed or replaced. There did appear to be at least one fantastic maid because one day we ended up with everything folded very artfully, clean dishes, plentiful shampoo and soap, and a lot of lovely little touches left around the room, but that was 1/6. Again, at a lesser hotel, I would accept this type of mediocre service, but for the amount we paid, I expected a little more. Perhaps I'm just in the dark about service in European hotels in general. The hotel offers free internet at restricted speeds and with transfer limits. Normally this would have been disastrous, but since I was NOT checking work mail or concerns, it was actually perfect. We still managed to call our parents using Skype several time with no problems. They do offer a business plan - 80 Euros for a week of unrestricted speed and transfer limits. We didn't bother. One point of note - you have to know about the *free* internet beforehand and ask for a password at the front desk; it wasn't advertised in the room or lobby at all. The hotel is unfortunately located across the street from a club which plays loud music late into the night. Fortunately, the windows and curtains are quite thick and keep out most of the sound. My husband, who usually has trouble sleeping if there is a lot of noise, slept soundly, although that could be because we walked Paris three times over. :) Two metro stops are close by: St. Philippe du Roule accesses a small but useful line (9); the FDR station (1,9) on the Champs-Élysées gave us easy access to almost everything else, although getting to the Latin Quarter was a bit of a challenge from here. One might think that a hotel at this price point should be all plus and no minus, but I don't think that actually exists. Most of the hotels we looked at for this price may have been more elegant or service oriented, but they looked like a tiny version of "Auntie's Parlor". We were willing to trade a bit of the "old world luxury" to avoid the "old world charm". I want to point out, I've purposely dwelled on the bad points in this review for full disclosure. The were many many good points: we're grateful for the refrigerator that kept our picnic dinner of cheeses, olives, pate, rose champagne, and the best macarons in Paris cold until we ate it while watching the Eiffel tower, to the front desk receptionist that went out of her way to guarantee our reservations at the Jules Verne, the 2 minute walk to a huge and hot shower and soft bed after spending a fantastic day with thousands of people on the Champs-Élysée watching the final stage of the Tour de France, the quite corner where my husband and I sat in the lobby looking through an art book, the lovely bowl of delicious cherries in the room when we arrived. We have many wonderful, irreplaceable memories of the Beauchamps! And like all love at first sight, the flaws are to be expected - the lasting fervor comes from rising a bit above all that.

Reviews.Title: “Saved me from a disastrous experience at another hotel”
Reviews.Author: PecositaPri
Reviews.Content: So after leaving the Elysees Mermoz hotel after 15 minutes (see my review on that hotel for additional details), I was close to breaking down and was wandering around the streets of Paris in search of another hotel for the night. Five minutes later I walked past the Hotel Beauchamps. I texted my boyfriend to ask him to look up the rates online. He told me what they were and then I went in and asked the receptionist if they had any availability for the night and the price. The receptionist was amazingly friendly and quoted a walk-in price that was EUR60 less than the online booking price, putting the room at the same price as what I would have paid at the Elysees Mermoz, had I stayed there. The other thing about the receptionist was that, once I explained that I had to leave at 5:30 the next morning, she offered me the single room which is usually used by business travelers. I really liked the way that she tailored the offer to match my needs. The decor of the hotel was definitely a bit funkier than the Elysees Mermoz and the bathrooms much smaller, but it was a great experience. The staff continued to tend to every need that I had, including putting me into the taxi after I had checked out at 5:30am.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid- money stolen by housekeeping!”
Reviews.Author: kcarl
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel! While we were staying there the housekeeping stole 300 euros from our safe!! We informed the hotel and they did nothing about it...did not even say sorry, they blamed us and told us we could not prove the money was stolen. Great location but not worth staying in a hotel with horrible customer service and staff, all we expected was an apology and they couldn't even offer that! What a waste of money!

Reviews.Title: “OMG- best hotel ive stayed in EVER”
Reviews.Author: daninsydney
Reviews.Content: I dont mind paying a little extra when the Hotel is as nice as this!!.. Clean, friendly staff!! good rooms, best view from 353!! Stayed in many other hotels in Paris that looked like nanna's bedroom..yuckl! There's a fabulous restaurant next door called Chez Diep, spent 3 nights in a row there, awesome food,again the best i've had! The area is great, a 1 min walk to the Champs Elesse, good cafes and shops, really this hotel has it all! An example of the great service was, i needed some documents printed for my next destination, forwarded the flight details to the front desk, within 15 minutes a guy came up and handed me an envelope with the papers folded inside !!!!... Dont hesitate and just book this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: piyushsavalia
Reviews.Content: I was attending a congress at Palle de congress. The hotel was just 4 metro station away. The rooms were very tiny but very neat and clean. The bathroom was very classy. The overall ambience of the hotel was very good. The morning breakfast was excellent. The food of the hotel was of good quality. I only had vegetarian food but it was good. I will go to the hotel again just for the staff. The front desk was outstanding and the support staff was excellent. Around the hotel there are a lot of clubs. There are many many restaurants of all kinds and also some good stores around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming chic hotel in the center of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Weanny
Reviews.Content: I was very happy to found this jewel for my stay in Paris. Located very close to champs-elysees & metro Franklin D. Roosevelt this hotel really makes my commuting to my office in La Defense very easy. The staff were all nice, especially in the Velvet restaurant & the front desk. The hotel room was cute, small though but then that's normal in europe with a very clean bathroom. It is also equip with a coffee maker & a microwave. The bed was ok eventhough a bit too soft for my taste. The only downside was the wifi access that you must ask daily for the password to thereception and it's only work for one device, so if you travel with your spouse and both of you have your own laptop for example you will need 2 password each day...but overall I was very satisfied with my stay and very thrilled to be able to show this side of Paris to my husband.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointing”
Reviews.Author: malbecblue
Reviews.Content: What a shame, as the hotel appears nice and the staff are friendly- but they have no real concept of customer service. I thought I'd treat myself as I don't get to Paris very often, and the location was good- hence it is not cheap. However, on arrival, I was told that, as I was on my own, my room had been DOWNGRADED to a single for the first night from the double I had booked. I was offered breakfast after the first night as compensation. However, on entering the room it was really, really small. You could almost touch the walls with outstretched arms. I also had to complain as the air conditioning was broken and it was a warm night, and opening the windows just exposed you to the sound of the generators- but was told there was no other option for that night. They even told me that the air conditioning in that part of the hotel was a known problem - so goodness knows why they thought a continental breakfast would be sufficient compensation! I was moved on the second night and was told all my belongings would be moved for me when I returned that night. They weren't - I had to go and get them myself and carry them to the other side of the hotel. I also didn't get the newspapers I had requested during my stay. However when I finally got the room I had booked - it was very nice, and what I had expected to pay for (about 4 times the size of the room on the first night). Like I said- a shame as the hotel seems nice, but customer service is terrible (I even waited to write this review as they said they would come back to me to anwer my complaint, but I figure giving them over a week was more than sufficient opportunity). Please try elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “could not have been any better!”
Reviews.Author: bluenose789
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week in Paris at this hotel. The hotel was obviously newly renovated and very modern. The staff were exceedingly helpful, even booking our requested restaurants prior to our arrival. We had booked a superior room, which was very clean and comfortable. Our bathroom was also clearly new, with modern appliances. Free wi-fi was available with a password from the front desk. Breakfast was included in our rate and it was excellent - eggs, bacon, cereals, smoked salmon, etc. The hotel is close to a Metro stop and the Champs Elysees. It is a busy area and not as quaint as some others. A couple of nights we could hear rowdy patrons from the bar across the street. But all in all, the hotel and staff were tremendous and contributed to a wonderful stay in Paris
